bibl.title: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, February 15, 1941

div1.p: McClain encloses a receipt for the amounts given to Washington and Jefferson College as gifts during the year 1940.

div1.head: Letter from A.V. McClain to Philip Showalter Hench, February 15, 1941
div1.opener:
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
February 15, 1941
ASSISTANT TO THE PRESIDENT
Dear Friend:
div1.p:
I am enclosing a receipt for amounts
you have given to Washington and Jefferson College
as gifts during the year 1940. We thought you
might like to have this receipt so that a proper
deduction may be made from your income tax. As
a matter of fact, the receipt may be filed with
your return if you wish.

This receipt covers only the amounts
you have given during 1940.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, A. V. McClain AVM/mb

div1.p:
Received of Dr. P. S. Hench
Two hundred and NO/100 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - DOLLARS
In gifts during the year 1940.

closer.signed:
Signed WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
BY A. V. McClain
